result.execSummary:
The defendant Sean M Murphy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.
DNA Surcharge waived.

Submit to an AODA assessment within the first 3 months of probation and follow through with any treatment, counseling. 
Maintain absolute sobriety/random urine screens if recommended by AODA assessment.  Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.

Maintain full-time employment.
If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sean M Murphy

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Sean M Murphy in court with attorney Gary E. Rosenthal.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Becky Van Dam, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Prosecuting attorney moves to strike the penalty enhancer on Count 1.  Court grants motion.  Penalty enhancer struck from Count 1.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 2 dismissed and read in.

Court orders the following:
- 90 days Huber with standard release conditions. STAYED
- 1 year Probation. 
- Court costs of $243.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- DNA Surcharge waived.
- Conditions of Probation: Submit to an AODA assessment within the first 3 months of probation and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs if recommended by AODA assessment.  Maintain full-time employment.  Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Sean M Murphy in court with attorney Gary E. Rosenthal.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant is not to have any violent contact with victim listed in the complaint.   Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous knives/weapons/firearms except for a bow for bow hunting.

Defendant Sean M Murphy in court with attorney Gary E. Rosenthal.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.   Defense counsel presents bail arguments. State objects to any modifications. Court modified the conditions.  Hearing scheduled for November 7, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
Defendant Sean M Murphy in court with attorney Gary E. Rosenthal.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Arraignment scheduled for October 13, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant is not to have any violent contact with victim listed in the complaint.   Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous knives/weapons/firearms.

Defendant Sean M Murphy in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.   Defendant to seek counsel.   Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing for the status of counsel.  Hearing scheduled for September 30, 2014 at 10:00 am.
